title: cfg(target_env) is not set correctly in build script
body:
I am attempting to use `cfg(target_env)` to build my program differently if the `target_env` is `musl`. I am new to using build scripts, so please point me in the right direction if I have missed something obvious or have made incorrect assumptions. 😄 

Unfortunately, the `target_env` is being erroneously set to `gnu`, but only in `build.rs`. In my program proper, the flag does seem to function correctly.

Curiously, `CARGO_CFG_TARGET_ENV` does seem to be set correctly, as seen in this example:

```
extern crate gcc;

use std::env;

#[cfg(target_env="musl")]
fn main() {
    println!("Target Env is MUSL");
    let var = env::var("CARGO_CFG_TARGET_ENV").unwrap();
    println!("ENV: {}", var);
}

#[cfg(target_env="gnu")]
fn main() {
    println!("TARGET ENV IS GNU");

    let var = env::var("CARGO_CFG_TARGET_ENV").unwrap();
    println!("ENV: {}", var);
}
```

Output: (when run with `cargo build --target x86_64-unknown-linux-musl -vv`)

```
TARGET ENV IS GNU
ENV: musl
```
